repo.description: Parse and serialize minecraft packets, plus authentication and encryption.
repo.name: node-minecraft-protocol

body:
* the hack in package.json is of course to be removed once Protocols is published
* it might be better to directly expose the datatype instead of creating an instance whenever we need to use a type

comment_data.body: Why ? This should be handled by protodef in the prepublish.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,8 @@
   },
   "scripts": {
     "prepublish": "gulp",
-    "test": "mocha --recursive --require intelli-espower-loader --require source-map-support/register --reporter spec"
+    "test": "mocha --recursive --require intelli-espower-loader --require source-map-support/register --reporter spec",
+    "postinstall": "node_modules/.bin/babel --recursive  --stage 0 -d node_modules/protodef/dist/ node_modules/protodef/src/"

comment_data.body: because of the npm bug about gulp + git dependencies. I'll remove it once protodef new version is published.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9,7 +9,8 @@
   },
   "scripts": {
     "prepublish": "gulp",
-    "test": "mocha --recursive --require intelli-espower-loader --require source-map-support/register --reporter spec"
+    "test": "mocha --recursive --require intelli-espower-loader --require source-map-support/register --reporter spec",
+    "postinstall": "node_modules/.bin/babel --recursive  --stage 0 -d node_modules/protodef/dist/ node_modules/protodef/src/"

comment_data.body: I feel like this should be easier...
ah yeah I forgot about this. datatypes should be exposed by protodef directly hmm...
That would be a really good use-case for anon type ! It would avoid changing everything to packet.params in our inner structure ;)

Or maybe not : we might conflict with ID. Urgh. I think it might be a good idea to rethink switch a tiny bit so it can "contain" what it switches on (id here) and avoid conflict, without making the API suck.
well, we do need the id too ;)
yes, but it sucks that we break API compat over something so trivial. It'd be nice if the proxy example didn't change. If it's not possible, that's ok then, it'll just be a MINOR bump.

well the proxy kind of got to change because the serializer doesn't know about packet names anymore (https://github.com/PrismarineJS/node-minecraft-protocol/pull/274/files#diff-662847b072812401e7452d353a20aeb4R136) since these are types now, not the "switch compareTo" or something.

Sure we could override createPacketBuffer and all, but that seems overkill to me, idk.

commit.message:
use protodef:
* move general datatypes to protodef along with their tests
* move states to states.js file
* use one protodef serializer by state and direction instead of one big serializer for everything (same thing for the deserializer)
* define a packet as a protodef type using a switch and a container, and adding each minecraft packet as a type (packet_ + name)
* use mapper type from protodef to convert id to name in packet definition
* use general string type : pstring
* divide by 10 the number of iteration in the benchmark to get back to a reasonable test execution time

fix gamemode3 in proxy : fix #146
* correctly generate the same uuidv3 than the vanilla server does in offline mode : fix #282
* remove "one player online mode" in the proxy : it doesn't make sense to identify all players as the user/passwd given in the cli. Now both servers in offline mode.

repo.description: Parse and serialize minecraft packets, plus authentication and encryption.

title: use protodef
